title: Why is the term enlightenment used today to mean something else other than it would have meant in the dark ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: The true meaning of enlightenment is to make contact with your immortal soul,which then ultimately opens the door to the SELF The self is that part of the absolute that resides within all of mankind it is the spirit within man that is the basic reality of being, the human body is just a vehicle used by the spirit to gain access to this dense physical earth plane. in this way enlightenment has been the same for thousands of years, its just now much easier to open the door to this refocusing of ones gaze from outward to inward, thousands of years ago only those in the priesthood could read and write, most of the rest were ignorant and illiterate, and only knew what they were told by the clergy.

It really only emerged in the 1700’s as the German culture broke free from religion to some degree and science developed, it came from the German meaning into the light and in this context really just means knowledge. Before this each culture and its own name from increased goodness/brain energy efficiency that had no science behind it, the new age movement uses it encompass goodness but technically is misusing as I do simply because so may people use it describe goodness/brain energy efficiency. It is still used to describe knowledge which helps to achieve goodness/brain energy efficiency, EGMi gives enlightenment/brain energy efficiency/goodness in one package.
